filmography.title: Intermezzo
filmography.role_description: A talented young piano teacher who falls in love with a famous, married violinist, sparking a scandalous affair.
filmography.plot: A famous violinist falls in love with his daughter's piano teacher, leading him to leave his family for an idyll in Europe before reality sets in.

filmography.title: Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde
filmography.role_description: A flirtatious barmaid who becomes the terrifying object of Mr. Hyde's sadistic affection and abuse.
filmography.plot: Dr. Jekyll allows his dark side to run wild when he drinks a potion that turns him into the evil Mr. Hyde.

filmography.title: Adam Had Four Sons
filmography.role_description: A devoted French governess who holds a wealthy family together through financial ruin and personal tragedy over many years.
filmography.plot: A governess becomes the center of a wealthy family after her employer's wife dies and his fortune collapses.

filmography.title: Rage in Heaven
filmography.role_description: The innocent wife of a mentally unstable man who devises a sinister plot to frame his best friend for his own murder.
filmography.plot: A jealous man concocts an elaborate scheme to frame his best friend for murder by killing himself.

filmography.title: Casablanca
filmography.role_description: A woman torn between her duty to her resistance-leader husband and her enduring love for a cynical American expatriate.
filmography.plot: A cynical expatriate American cafe owner struggles to decide whether or not to help his former lover and her fugitive husband escape the Nazis in French Morocco.

filmography.title: For Whom the Bell Tolls
filmography.role_description: A young Spanish woman, traumatized by the Civil War, who finds love and healing with an American dynamiter fighting for the Republicans.
filmography.plot: During the Spanish Civil War, an American allied with the Republicans finds romance during a desperate mission to blow up a bridge.

filmography.title: Gaslight
filmography.role_description: A fragile heiress who begins to doubt her own sanity as her domineering new husband subtly manipulates her reality.
filmography.plot: Ten years after her aunt was murdered in their London home, a woman returns from Italy in the 1880s to resume residence with her new husband.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: Spellbound
filmography.role_description: A cool and intellectual psychoanalyst who falls in love with the new head of her hospital, only to discover he is an amnesiac impostor.
filmography.plot: A psychiatrist protects the identity of an amnesia patient accused of murder while attempting to recover his memory.

filmography.title: Saratoga Trunk
filmography.role_description: A scheming Creole woman who returns to New Orleans to scandalize her father's family and snag a wealthy husband.
filmography.plot: A Texas gambler and the daughter of a Creole aristocrat become lovers and partners as they try to make their fortunes.

filmography.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
filmography.role_description: A dedicated and strong-willed nun who clashes with an unconventional priest over the best way to run their inner-city school.
filmography.plot: At a big city Catholic school, an easy-going priest and a no-nonsense nun disagree on how to educate the children.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress

filmography.title: Notorious
filmography.role_description: The daughter of a convicted Nazi spy who is recruited by American intelligence to infiltrate a ring of scientists in Brazil.
filmography.plot: A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America. How far will she have to go to ingratiate herself with them?

filmography.title: Arch of Triumph
filmography.role_description: A suicidal singer in pre-WWII Paris who finds a tragic romance with a refugee doctor living in the shadows.
filmography.plot: In 1938 Paris, a refugee doctor and a woman with a past try to find happiness while avoiding deportation.

filmography.title: Joan of Arc
filmography.role_description: The teenage French peasant girl who claims divine guidance and leads the French army to victory against the English.
filmography.plot: The massive historical epic of the life of the French heroine and saint, from her peasant roots to her martyrdom.

filmography.title: Under Capricorn
filmography.role_description: An aristocratic Irishwoman in 19th-century Australia who has descended into alcoholism and is dominated by her housekeeper.
filmography.plot: A young man visits Australia and uncovers the dark secrets of a wealthy landowner and his disturbed wife.

filmography.title: Stromboli
filmography.role_description: A Lithuanian refugee who marries an Italian fisherman to escape an internment camp, only to find herself trapped on a desolate volcanic island.
filmography.plot: A young refugee marries a fisherman to escape a prisoner of war camp, but finds life in his village on a volcanic island to be a different kind of prison.

filmography.title: Europa '51
filmography.role_description: A wealthy socialite who, after her son's suicide, devotes her life to the poor, leading her family to question her sanity.
filmography.plot: After her son commits suicide, a wealthy woman finds comfort in helping the poor, but her husband thinks she is insane.
filmography.awards: Venice Film Festival: Win – Volpi Cup (Best Actress)

filmography.title: Fear
filmography.role_description: An adulterous wife who is blackmailed by her lover's ex-girlfriend, leading her into a spiral of guilt and paranoia.
filmography.plot: A woman's infidelity leads to a blackmail plot that threatens to destroy her life.

filmography.title: Journey to Italy
filmography.role_description: A refined Englishwoman whose marriage unravels during a trip to Naples as she and her husband realize they are strangers.
filmography.plot: An unhappy English couple travel to Naples to sell a villa, where the beautiful surroundings bring their marital problems to the surface.

filmography.title: Anastasia
filmography.role_description: A suicidal woman with amnesia who is groomed by a con man to pose as the Grand Duchess Anastasia, but who may actually be her.
filmography.plot: An opportunistic Russian businessman tries to pass a mysterious impostor as the Grand Duchess Anastasia, but she is so convincing that even skeptics believe her.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)

filmography.title: Elena and Her Men
filmography.role_description: A charming, impoverished Polish princess in pre-WWI Paris who believes she can inspire greatness in the men she loves.
filmography.plot: A Polish princess in Paris flirts with a general, a count, and a wealthy industrialist, influencing the political future of France.

filmography.title: Indiscreet
filmography.role_description: A successful actress who falls for a charming diplomat, only to discover he lied about being married to avoid commitment.
filmography.plot: An American diplomat in London falls in love with a famous actress, but he pretends to be married to avoid marriage.

filmography.title: The Inn of the Sixth Happiness
filmography.role_description: A determined British maid who overcomes rejection to become a missionary in China, eventually leading orphans to safety during the war.
filmography.plot: The true story of an Englishwoman who becomes a missionary in China and leads a group of children on a perilous journey through enemy territory.

filmography.title: Goodbye Again
filmography.role_description: A successful 40-year-old interior designer who begins an affair with a much younger man to escape her neglectful lover.
filmography.plot: A forty-year-old woman begins a romance with a 25-year-old man, causing her long-time lover to finally take notice.

filmography.title: The Visit
filmography.role_description: A fabulously wealthy woman who returns to her impoverished hometown offering a fortune to the residents in exchange for the life of the man who scorned her.
filmography.plot: A wealthy woman returns to her hometown and offers the residents a fortune if they will kill the man who seduced and abandoned her years ago.

filmography.title: The Yellow Rolls-Royce
filmography.role_description: A wealthy American widow touring Europe in 1941 who unwittingly smuggles a Yugoslav partisan to safety in her car.
filmography.plot: Three stories about the lives and loves of those who own a specific yellow Rolls-Royce Phantom II.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Original Song

filmography.title: Cactus Flower
filmography.role_description: A prickly, efficient dental nurse who secretly loves her boss and blossoms when she agrees to pose as his wife.
filmography.plot: A dentist pretends to be married to avoid commitment, but when he falls for his girlfriend, he recruits his nurse to play his 'wife'.

filmography.title: A Walk in the Spring Rain
filmography.role_description: A professor's wife who finds unexpected passion and tragedy with a rural neighbor while vacationing in Tennessee.
filmography.plot: When her husband moves them to a small farming town, a woman falls in love with a married neighbor.

filmography.title: Murder on the Orient Express
filmography.role_description: A timid, intensely religious Swedish missionary who becomes a suspect in a murder aboard a snowbound train.
filmography.plot: In December 1935, when his train is stopped by deep snow, detective Hercule Poirot is called on to solve a murder that occurred in his car the night before.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actress; BAFTA: Win – Best Supporting Actress

filmography.title: A Matter of Time
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, faded countess living in a decrepit hotel who recounts her glamorous past to a young chambermaid.
filmography.plot: A chambermaid in a Rome hotel is inspired by an eccentric old countess who tells stories of her glorious past.
filmography.awards: Notable Performance in a Critically Panned Film

filmography.title: Autumn Sonata
filmography.role_description: A world-famous concert pianist who visits her estranged daughter, leading to a painful confrontation about their past.
filmography.plot: A celebrated classical pianist visits her neglected daughter, whom she hasn't seen in seven years, and old wounds are opened.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Actress; Golden Globe: Win – Best Actress (Drama)
